definition: lanes and alleys/neighborhood/lane neighborhoods in parts of Shanghai, with modified Chinese courtyard houses, occupied by single families in the 1930s, now crowded with multiple families

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: Yet only a few lilong appear on the list of protected areas.
sentences.chinese: 但只有少數里弄上了受保護名單。

sentences.english: Getting free soda out of the machines became a national sport.
sentences.chinese: 免費從售貨機里弄出汽水後來成爲了一項全國運動。

sentences.english: On rainy days the children really mess up the house.
sentences.chinese: 下雨天孩子們把房子里弄得良莠沒有齊的。

sentences.english: They pulled it out of their noses and rubbed it on paper.
sentences.chinese: 他們把從鼻孔里弄出來的東西塗抹到紙上。

sentences.english: You might decide to include a special extra with the letter.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在信里弄一些特別的東西。

definition: to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
"shikumen" style architecture: traditional (ca. 19th century) residences with courtyards, once common in Shanghai
to move/to shift/to exchange/to buy and sell/peddling
to fiddle with sth/to trade with sth
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
